grammar.title: N은/는 N이에요/예요
grammar.description: 정체성 설명. This is … / It is …

grammar.title: N에 있어요[없어요]
grammar.translation: There is a book in the room.

grammar.title: N 앞[뒤, 옆]
grammar.translation: There is a bookstore in front of the school.

exams.question: Choose the correct identification sentence using N은/는 N이에요/예요.
Pick the correct negative identification with N이/가 아닙니다.
Which sentence shows demonstrative identification with 이거는 N이에요/예요?
Choose the correct location identification with 여기가 N이에요/예요.
Which particle marks a static location correctly (N에)?

summaries.title: Lesson 1: Basic Identification & Copula
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N은/는 N이에요/예요: This is …
- N입니까?: Is it …?
- N이/가 아닙니다: It is not …
- 이거는 N이에요/예요: This is …
- 여기가 N이에요/예요: Here is …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 학생 (student), 선생님 (teacher), 책 (book), 교실 (classroom), 학교 (school)

Cultural Notes:
- Basic copula patterns form the foundation of Korean identification sentences.

grammar.title: N이/가 있어요[없어요]
grammar.description: 존재 여부. There is / There isn’t …
grammar.translation: There is a book. There isn’t money.

grammar.title: V-고
grammar.translation: I ate and went to school.

exams.question: Choose the correct existence statement with N이/가 있어요.
Pick the correct polite request sentence with N 주세요.
Select the natural noun listing sentence using N하고 N.
Which sentence uses the object marker correctly (N을/를)?
Choose the correct place-of-action sentence using N에서.

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Existence & Location
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N이/가 있어요[없어요]: There is / There isn’t …
- N 주세요: Please give me …
- N하고 N: And (nouns)
- N을/를: Object particle
- N에서: At / from …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 물 (water), 사과 (apple), 바나나 (banana), 밥 (rice/meal), 도서관 (library)

Cultural Notes:
- Existence expressions are essential for daily needs and requests.

exams.question: Select the correct polite imperative sentence using V-(으)세요.
Which sentence shows a state description correctly (N이/가 A-아요/어요)?
Pick the correct additive expression using N도.
Choose the correct contrastive expression with A/V-지만.
Which sentence expresses a suggestion using V-(으)ㄹ까요?

summaries.title: Lesson 3: Requests & Simple Actions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)세요: Please do …
- N이/가 A-아요/어요: Describing state (It is …)
- N도: Also / too
- A/V-지만: But / although …
- A/V-습니다/ㅂ니다: Formal polite statement

Essential Vocabulary:
- 날씨 (weather), 철수 (Cheolsu), 수영 (swimming), 친구 (friend), 책 (book)

Cultural Notes:
- Polite requests and simple actions help in basic social interaction.

grammar.title: V-아서/어서
grammar.translation: I was sick so I went to the hospital.

exams.question: Choose the honorific copula sentence with N(이)세요.
Pick the sentence that uses the honorific suffix -(으)시- correctly.
Which sentence shows a time range with N부터 N까지?
Choose the correct prohibition using V-지 마세요.
Pick the correct obligation expression with V-아야/어야 되다.

summaries.title: Lesson 4: Particles & Connectives
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N(이)세요: Honorific copula
- A/V-(으)시-: Honorific suffix
- N부터 N까지: From … to …
- V-아서/어서: Because / and then …
- V-(으)ㄹ 거예요: Will … (future)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 병원 (hospital), 월요일 (Monday), 금요일 (Friday), 숙제 (homework), 맞다 (to be right)

Cultural Notes:
- Particles and connectives link ideas smoothly in beginner sentences.

grammar.title: A/V-아서/어서
grammar.translation: I couldn’t go because it rained.

exams.question: Choose the correct progressive form using V-고 있다.
Pick the correct inability expression using 못 V.
Which sentence uses the reason connector -아서/어서 correctly?
Choose the correct expression of intention using V-(으)려고 하다.
Pick the correct benefactive sentence with V-아/어 주다.

summaries.title: Lesson 5: Tense & Polite Forms
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-고 있다: Progressive aspect (be -ing)
- 못 V: Cannot …
- A/V-아서/어서: Because …
- V-(으)려고 하다: Intend to …
- N에서 N까지: From … to …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 문 (door), 버스 (bus), 꽃 (flower), 친구 (friend), 학교 (school)

Cultural Notes:
- Expressing tense and politeness makes everyday communication natural.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)면
grammar.translation: If you have time, call me.

grammar.title: V-(으)러 가다[오다]
grammar.description: 목적 이동. Go/Come in order to …

exams.question: Select the correct recommendation sentence using V-아/어 보세요.
Choose the correct conditional sentence with A/V-(으)면.
Pick the correct desire expression using V-고 싶다.
Which sentence correctly expresses possibility with V-(으)ㄹ 수 있다.
Choose the correct simultaneous action sentence with V-(으)면서.

summaries.title: Lesson 6: Comparisons & Additions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-아/어 보세요: Please try …
- A/V-(으)면: If …
- V-는 N: Verb modifying noun
- V-고 싶다: I want to …
- V-고 싶어 하다: He/She wants to …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 옷 (clothes), 시간 (time), 한국어 (Korean language), 아침 (morning), 저녁 (evening)

Cultural Notes:
- Comparisons and additions expand sentence variety.

exams.question: Choose the correct ability expression with V-(으)ㄹ 수 있다.
Pick the correct impossibility expression with V-(으)ㄹ 수 없다.
Which sentence uses 못 V correctly?
Choose the correct negation with 안 V.
Pick the correct obligation sentence with V-아야/어야 되다.

summaries.title: Lesson 7: Abilities & Possibility
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄹ까요?: Suggestion / conjecture
- V-(으)ㄹ 수 있다: Can …
- V-(으)ㄹ 수 없다: Cannot …
- 못 V: Cannot … (alt)
- 안 V: Don’t …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 한국어 (Korean language), 수영 (swimming), 숙제 (homework), 밥 (meal), 사진 (photo)

Cultural Notes:
- Expressions of ability and possibility help in planning and offering.

exams.question: Choose the correct honorific suffix sentence with A/V-(으)시-.
Pick the correct time range expression with N부터 N까지.
Which sentence shows progressive action with V-고 있다?
Choose the correct simultaneous action with V-(으)면서.
Pick the correct formal polite ending sentence.

summaries.title: Lesson 8: Everyday Communication
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-(으)시-: Honorific suffix
- N부터 N까지: From … to …
- V-(으)려고 하다: Intend to …
- V-고 있다: Progressive aspect
- V-(으)면서: While …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 감사합니다 (thank you), 아침 (morning), 저녁 (evening), 학생 (student), 전화 (phone)

Cultural Notes:
- Everyday grammar patterns make conversation polite and natural.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ까요?
grammar.description: 제안·의견 묻기 등을 나타내는 의문형입니다. Question ending for suggestions/opinions ('shall we/shall I').

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 거예요
grammar.description: 미래 계획/추측을 나타냅니다. Future intention or conjecture.

grammar.title: A/V-지요?, N(이)지요?
grammar.description: 확인/공유된 사실을 물을 때 씁니다. Seeks confirmation/shared info ('..., right?').

grammar.title: V-(으)려고 하다
grammar.description: 의도/계획을 나타냅니다. Expresses intention 'be about to/plan to'.

grammar.title: V-고 싶다
grammar.description: 화자의 희망/바람을 나타냅니다. Expresses desire 'want to'.
grammar.translation: I want to go to Korea.

grammar.title: V-고 싶어 하다
grammar.description: 제3자의 희망을 전할 때 씁니다. Third person’s desire 'want to'.
grammar.translation: My younger sibling wants to play a game.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ게요
grammar.description: 화자의 약속/의지를 나타냅니다(상대 배려). Speaker’s promise/volition (for listener’s sake).

exams.question: Choose the sentence that best expresses a suggestion using V-(으)ㄹ까요?
Pick the sentence that correctly shows promise/volition for the listener with V-(으)ㄹ게요.
Fill in the blank with the most natural ending: "창문을 _____?" (Ask for confirmation that the listener will close it).
Which sentence correctly reports a third person’s desire using V-고 싶어 하다?
Choose the correct future intention using V-(으)ㄹ 거예요.
Error correction: Find the best correction of "약을 먹을까요 해야 돼요."

summaries.title: Lesson 1 — Core usage
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄹ까요? suggestion / asking opinion
- V-(으)ㄹ 거예요 future intention or conjecture
- V-아/어야 되다 obligation; A/V-지요? confirmation
- V-(으)려고 하다 plan; V-고 싶다 & V-고 싶어 하다 desire (self vs third person); V-(으)ㄹ게요 promise for listener
Essential Vocabulary:
- 점심, 내일, 숙제, 약, 오늘, 수업
Cultural Notes:
- -(으)ㄹ게요 shows consideration for the listener
- -지요? soft confirmation when speaker assumes shared info

grammar.title: N은/는 N이에요/예요
grammar.description: 사물이나 사람의 정체를 설명할 때 쓰는 평서형 종결 표현입니다. A polite statement used to identify or describe what something/someone is.

grammar.title: N입니까?
grammar.description: 정체를 묻는 격식 있는 의문문입니다. A formal/polite question used to ask identification.

grammar.title: N이/가 아닙니다
grammar.description: 부정을 나타내는 격식 있는 표현입니다. Formal negative copula meaning 'is not'.

grammar.title: A/V-습니다/ㅂ니다
grammar.description: 격식체 평서/의문/명령 형태의 기본 종결입니다. Formal polite sentence ending.

grammar.title: N(이)세요
grammar.description: 존대 높임의 정중한 표현입니다. Honorific copula used politely.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)시-
grammar.description: 주어 높임의 선어말 어미입니다. Subject-honorific pre-final ending.

exams.question: Select the correct formal identification sentence.
Choose the formal question form using N입니까?
Pick the correct formal negative copula.
Which sentence uses N(이)세요 appropriately (honorific)?
Choose the sentence that correctly applies the subject-honorific -(으)시-.

summaries.title: Lesson 50 — Formal identification
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N이에요/예요 polite ID; formal A/V-습니다/ㅂ니다
- N입니까? formal question; N이/가 아닙니다 formal negative
- Subject honorific -(으)시-; N(이)세요
Essential Vocabulary:
- 입니다, 입니까, 아닙니다, 선생님, 여기
Cultural Notes:
- Formal style is frequent in announcements and customer service
- Honorifics combine with formal endings

summaries.title: Lesson 1: Identification & Honorifics ? Core Usage
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N은/는 N이에요/예요: Polite statement identifying or describing a subject.
- N입니까?: Formal/polite interrogative asking for identification.
- N이/가 아닙니다: Formal negative copula meaning "is not".
- A/V-습니다/ㅂ니다: Standard formal sentence ending for statements/questions.
- N(이)세요 & A/V-(으)시-: Honorific forms for showing respect.

Essential Vocabulary:
- 학생 (student), 선생님 (teacher), 회사원 (office worker), 은행 (bank), 서울역 (Seoul Station)

Cultural Notes:
- Honorifics (?(으)시?, N(이)세요) are central to Korean politeness.
- Formal endings (?ㅂ니다/습니다) are widely used in public speech and announcements.

grammar.title: 이거는[그거는, 저거는] N이에요/예요
grammar.description: 지시 대명사와 함께 대상의 정체를 설명합니다. Uses demonstratives (this/that) to identify an item.

grammar.title: 여기가 N이에요/예요
grammar.description: 장소를 지칭하며 확인할 때 쓰는 표현입니다. Used to point out/confirm a place.

grammar.title: N이/가 A-아요/어요
grammar.description: 사물의 성질/상태를 설명하는 형용사 서술문입니다. Adjective predicate describing a subject.

grammar.title: N을/를 잘하다[잘 못하다]
grammar.description: 능숙함/미숙함을 말할 때 씁니다. Expresses being good/poor at something.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ N
grammar.description: 형용사가 뒤의 명사를 수식합니다. Adnominal form of adjectives.

grammar.title: V-는 N
grammar.description: 동사가 뒤의 명사를 수식합니다(현재). Adnominal present form for verbs.

exams.question: Pick the correct identification sentence with a demonstrative.
Select the sentence that points out a location using 여기가 N이에요/예요.
Choose the correct adjective predicate with A-아요/어요.
Pick the correct adnominal adjective form A-(으)ㄴ N.
Select the correct adnominal present for verbs V-는 N.

summaries.title: Lesson 51 — Demonstratives & modifiers
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 이/그/저 + N; 이거/그거/저거 identification
- 여기가 N이에요 for pointing out a place
- A-(으)ㄴ N and V-는 N adnominals
Essential Vocabulary:
- 사과, 가방, 교실, 약속, 음식, 학생
Cultural Notes:
- 그 usually refers to something previously mentioned
- Adnominals are common in noun-heavy Korean phrasing

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Demonstratives & Descriptions ? Core Usage
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 이거는/그거는/저거는 N이에요/예요: Identifying objects using demonstratives.
- 여기가 N이에요/예요: Confirming or pointing out a place.
- N이/가 A-아요/어요: Adjective predicate describing a state or property.
- N을/를 잘하다/잘 못하다: Expressing ability or lack of ability.
- A-(으)ㄴ N, V-는 N: Adnominal forms to modify nouns.

Essential Vocabulary:
- 책 (book), 가방 (bag), 음식 (food), 방 (room), 친구 (friend)

Cultural Notes:
- Demonstratives (이/그/저) depend on relative distance from speaker and listener.
- Using adnominal endings (?(으)ㄴ/?는) makes descriptions more natural in daily conversation.

grammar.title: N하고 N
grammar.description: 체언을 나열할 때 쓰는 구어체 연결 조사입니다. Colloquial connector meaning 'and' between nouns.

grammar.title: N을/를
grammar.description: 목적어를 표시하는 목적격 조사입니다. Object particle marking the direct object.

grammar.title: N(의) N
grammar.description: 소유나 소속을 나타냅니다. Genitive particle indicating possession.

grammar.title: N한테[께]
grammar.description: 사람에게 방향·수혜를 나타냅니다. ‘께’는 높임. To/for someone; honorific form is '께'.
grammar.translation: I gave a present to a friend.

exams.question: Choose the natural colloquial connector meaning 'and' between nouns.
Which sentence correctly marks the object with 을/를?
Pick the sentence that uses the additive particle 도 appropriately.
Choose the correct possessive construction with (의).
Select the correct recipient marking with 한테/께.

summaries.title: Lesson 52 — Core particles
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- Object 을/를; additive 도; possessive (의)
- Only 만; recipient 한테/께; colloquial connector 하고
Essential Vocabulary:
- 책, 물, 친구, 선물, 학교, 토요일
Cultural Notes:
- (의) is often pronounced "에" in speech
- 한테 is casual; 께 is honorific

grammar.title: N이/가 있어요[없어요]
grammar.description: 존재나 소유를 말할 때 쓰는 표현입니다. Used to say that something exists or someone has something.

grammar.title: N에서
grammar.description: 행위가 일어나는 장소를 나타냅니다. Marks the place where an action occurs.

grammar.title: N에 있어요[없어요]
grammar.description: 사물의 위치를 나타냅니다. Indicates the location of something.
grammar.translation: The book is on the desk.

grammar.title: N 앞[뒤, 옆]
grammar.description: 기준 위치를 나타내는 표현입니다. Indicates relative location (in front of/behind/next to).
grammar.translation: There is a bus stop in front of the bank.

grammar.title: N에
grammar.description: 시간·장소의 기준을 표시합니다. General locative/temporal particle 'at/in/on/to'.

exams.question: Choose the correct existence/possession statement with 있다/없다.
Pick the sentence that correctly uses N에서 for the place of action.
Choose the correct static location marking with N에.
Select the correct relative position expression.
Which sentence uses N에 for time correctly?

summaries.title: Lesson 53 — Existence & location
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N이/가 있어요/없어요 possession or existence
- 에서 place of action vs 에 static location/time
- Relative positions: 앞, 뒤, 옆, 위
Essential Vocabulary:
- 시간, 책상, 지갑, 가방, 버스 정류장, 공원
Cultural Notes:
- 위치 표현은 영어 전치사와 대응하지만 조사 위치가 다름
- 시간 표현도 에 로 표시

grammar.title: N에 가요[와요]
grammar.description: 이동의 목적지/출발지를 나타냅니다. Indicates destination (go/come to N).

grammar.title: N부터 N까지
grammar.description: 범위의 시작과 끝을 나타냅니다. Indicates range 'from N to N'.
grammar.translation: I work from morning to evening.

grammar.title: N에서  N까지
grammar.description: 장소의 범위를 나타냅니다. Range from place to place.
grammar.translation: I walk from home to work.

grammar.title: N(으)로
grammar.description: 방향/수단/재료 등을 나타냅니다. Indicates direction, means, or material.

grammar.title: V-(으)러 가다[오다]
grammar.description: 목적을 나타내는 이동 표현입니다. Go/come in order to do something.
grammar.translation: I go to the library to borrow a book.

exams.question: Choose the correct sentence for destination with N에 가요/와요.
Pick the proper range expression using N부터 N까지.
Select the correct place-to-place range using N에서 N까지.
Which sentence correctly uses (으)로 for means/material?
Choose the correct purpose-of-movement construction with V-(으)러 가다/오다.

summaries.title: Lesson 54 — Movement & purpose
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- Destination N에 가요/와요
- Range N부터 N까지, N에서 N까지
- Means/direction (으)로; purpose V-(으)러 가다/오다
Essential Vocabulary:
- 집, 한국, 버스, 도서관, 친구, 서울/부산
Cultural Notes:
- (으)로 with transport: 버스로 가요
- -(으)러 takes verb stems ending with ㄹ contraction 주의

grammar.title: V-아요/어요
grammar.description: 동사의 현재/일반 시제의 존댓말 어미입니다. Polite present/general tense verb ending.

grammar.title: V-았/었-
grammar.description: 과거 시제를 만드는 선어말 어미입니다. Pre-final ending for past tense.

grammar.title: V-고 있다
grammar.description: 진행 중인 동작을 나타냅니다. Progressive aspect 'be -ing'.

exams.question: Pick the correct polite present tense ending.
Choose the sentence that correctly expresses past tense with -았/었-.
Select the correct progressive construction with -고 있다.
Which sentence best translates 'I exercise every day'?
Identify the aspect/tense of '영화를 보고 있어요.'

summaries.title: Lesson 55 — Tense & progressive
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- Present V-아요/어요; past -았/었-
- Progressive -고 있다; time adverbs 어제/오늘/매일
Essential Vocabulary:
- 운동, 매일, 지금, 어제, 영화, 점심
Cultural Notes:
- Progressive often implies temporary state
- Past marker attaches before the polite ending

grammar.title: V-고
grammar.description: 동작의 나열이나 순서를 나타내는 연결 어미입니다. Connective ending meaning 'and/and then'.
grammar.translation: I ate and then did homework.

grammar.title: A/V-지만
grammar.description: 대조/양보를 나타내는 연결 어미입니다. Contrastive connector meaning 'but/although'.

grammar.title: A/V-고
grammar.translation: The weather is cold and windy.

grammar.title: V-아서/어서
grammar.description: 이유/원인 또는 순차를 나타냅니다. Indicates reason/cause or sequence ('so/and then').
grammar.translation: I was tired so I slept early.

grammar.title: A/V-아서/어서
grammar.description: 이유/원인을 나타내는 연결 어미입니다. Connective for reason ('because/so').
grammar.translation: It rained, so I couldn’t go out.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)면
grammar.translation: If you have time, call me.

grammar.title: V-(으)면서
grammar.description: 동시 동작을 나타냅니다. Indicates simultaneous actions ('while -ing').
grammar.translation: I study while listening to music.

exams.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses the connective V-고 for sequence.
Pick the correct contrastive connector A/V-지만.
Select the correct reason clause with -아서/어서.
Which sentence correctly uses the conditional -(으)면?
Choose the sentence indicating simultaneous actions with -(으)면서.

summaries.title: Lesson 56 — Linking & logic
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- Sequence V-고; contrast A/V-지만
- Reason -아서/어서; condition -(으)면
- Simultaneity -(으)면서
Essential Vocabulary:
- 피곤하다, 문, 비, 음악, 시간
Cultural Notes:
- -(으)면 is general if/when; context decides
- -아서/어서 does not take past or imperative in the first clause

grammar.title: N 주세요
grammar.description: 요청이나 주문할 때 쓰는 공손한 표현입니다. Polite request meaning 'please give me N'.
grammar.translation: Please give me a glass of water.

grammar.title: V-(으)세요
grammar.description: 상대 높임의 청유/명령 표현입니다. Polite imperative/honorific request form.

grammar.title: V-지 마세요
grammar.description: 금지를 나타내는 공손한 표현입니다. Polite prohibition 'please don’t'.

grammar.title: V-아/어 주다
grammar.description: 상대에게 도움을 주는 행위입니다. Do something for someone.

grammar.title: V-아/어 보세요
grammar.description: 권유/제안을 공손하게 말합니다. Polite suggestion 'please try -ing'.

exams.question: Pick the correct polite request using N 주세요.
Choose the correct polite imperative V-(으)세요.
Select the correct prohibition V-지 마세요.
Which sentence correctly expresses doing something for someone with V-아/어 주다?
Choose the correct polite suggestion 'please try -ing' with V-아/어 보세요.

summaries.title: Lesson 57 — Requests & help
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N 주세요 request; V-(으)세요 polite imperative
- V-지 마세요 prohibition
- V-아/어 주다 benefactive; V-아/어 보세요 try
Essential Vocabulary:
- 물, 김치, 말하다, 앉다, 도와주다, 사진
Cultural Notes:
- 주세요 vs 주십시오 (more formal); -세요 is common in service talk
- Softening with 좀 is natural in speech

grammar.title: 안 V
grammar.description: 행위를 부정하는 안 부정문입니다. Short form negation placed before a verb.

grammar.title: 못 V
grammar.translation: I can’t go because I have no time.

exams.question: Choose the correct short-form negation ‘안 V’.
Pick the correct expression of inability with ‘못 V’.
Select the correct ability construction with V-(으)ㄹ 수 있다/없다.
Which sentence best expresses present impossibility using V-(으)ㄹ 수 없다?
Identify the most accurate statement about ‘안 V’ vs ‘못 V’.
options: ‘안 V’는 의지적 부정, ‘못 V’는 능력/상황의 불가능

summaries.title: Lesson 58 — Negation & ability
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 안 V simple/volitional negation
- 못 V inability or situational impossibility
- V-(으)ㄹ 수 있다/없다 ability
Essential Vocabulary:
- 커피, 버스, 시간, 수영, 한국어, 네/아니요
Cultural Notes:
- 안 vs 못 difference is semantic, not politeness
- Ability construction places 수 before 있다/없다

grammar.title: A-다고 하다
grammar.translation: He said that he is a student.

grammar.title: A-(으)냐고 하다
grammar.translation: He asked where I was going.

grammar.title: V-(으)라고 하다
grammar.translation: He told me to be quiet.

exams.question: Choose the correct reported statement with A-다고 하다.
Pick the correct colloquial reported speech with A-대요.

Choose the correct reported suggestion with V-자고 하다.
Pick the correct reported command with V-(으)라고 하다.

summaries.title: Lesson 1: Reported Speech I
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A-다고 하다: Reported statement
- A-대(요): Colloquial reported speech
- A-다고 들었다: I heard that …
- A-(으)냐고 하다: Reported question
- V-자고 하다: Reported suggestion

Essential Vocabulary:
- 소문 (rumor), 이야기 (story), 대화 (conversation), 친구 (friend), 질문 (question)

Cultural Notes:
- Reported speech allows relaying information from others.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ가 보다
grammar.translation: It seems he is a student.

grammar.title: N(이)나
grammar.translation: Let’s read a book or something.

grammar.title: V-아/어 보니까
grammar.translation: I found it fun after trying.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ까 말까 하다
grammar.translation: I’m hesitating whether to go or not.

grammar.title: V-지 그래요?
grammar.translation: Why don’t you take a rest?

exams.question: Choose the correct expression of assumption with A-(으)ㄴ가 보다.
Pick the correct sentence with N(이)나 meaning "or something".
Which sentence shows hesitation with V-(으)ㄹ까 말까 하다?
Choose the correct regret expression with V-(으)ㄹ걸 그랬다.
Pick the correct explanation sentence with A/V-거든요.

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Reported Speech II & Commands
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)라고 하다: Reported command
- A/V-다니까(요): Emphatic rebuttal
- A/V-다니(요): Expressing surprise
- V-지 그래요?: Why don’t you …
- V-(으)ㄹ걸 그랬다: Regret (I should have …)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 명령 (order), 부탁 (request), 제안 (suggestion), 조언 (advice), 후회 (regret)

Cultural Notes:
- Commands and suggestions are softened in Korean to maintain politeness.

grammar.title: V-자마자
grammar.translation: I called as soon as I arrived.

grammar.title: V-느라고
grammar.translation: I couldn’t go because I was studying.

grammar.title: V-았다가/었다가
grammar.description: 상반 행동. Did and then… (different action).
grammar.translation: I went and then came back.

grammar.title: V-아/어 보니까
grammar.description: 경험 후 인식. After doing, I realized…

grammar.title: V-아/어 보니
grammar.description: 알게 됨. Came to know after doing.

grammar.title: V-고 보니
grammar.description: 뒤늦게 알게 됨. After doing, found out…

grammar.title: V-(으)려면
grammar.translation: If you want to pass, you must study hard.

exams.question: Choose the correct immediate sequence sentence with V-자마자.
Pick the correct excuse sentence using V-느라고.
Which sentence expresses instruction with V-도록 하다?
Choose the correct sequential sentence using V-다(가).
Pick the correct reversal action with V-았다가/었다가.

summaries.title: Lesson 3: Cause & Sequential Actions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-자마자: As soon as …
- V-느라고: Because (negative cause)
- V-도록 하다: Make sure to …
- V-았다가/었다가: Did and then (contrast action)
- V-고 보니: After doing, found out …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 도착 (arrival), 이유 (reason), 결과 (result), 습관 (habit), 공부 (study)

Cultural Notes:
- Korean uses many sequential forms to connect causes and effects naturally.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 텐데
grammar.translation: He must have arrived by now.

exams.question: Choose the correct assumption with A-(으)ㄴ가 보다.
Pick the correct inference with V-나 보다.
Which sentence expresses probability with A/V-(으)ㄹ 걸(요)?
Choose the correct guess expression with A/V-(으)ㄹ 듯하다.
Pick the correct expression of likelihood with A/V-는 것 같다.

summaries.title: Lesson 4: Assumptions & Inferences
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A-(으)ㄴ가 보다: I guess …
- V-나 보다: It seems …
- N인가 보다: I guess it is …
- A/V-겠지(요): I suppose …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 듯하다: It seems …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 아마 (probably), 추측 (guess), 기분 (feeling), 이유 (reason), 상황 (situation)

Cultural Notes:
- Inferences often use soft endings to avoid sounding too direct.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄴ데도
grammar.translation: He went even though he was sick.

grammar.title: A/V-는데도
grammar.translation: He eats a lot but is skinny.

grammar.title: 아무리 A/V-아도/어도
grammar.translation: No matter how busy, you must come.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ지라도
grammar.translation: Even if late, I will go.

grammar.title: A/V-더라도
grammar.translation: Even if it’s hard, you must do it.

exams.question: Choose the correct contrast sentence with A/V-지만.
Pick the correct concessive with A/V-는데도.
Which sentence expresses concession with A/V-아/어도?
Choose the correct extreme concession with 아무리 A/V-아도/어도.
Pick the correct far-from expression with A/V-기는커녕.

summaries.title: Lesson 5: Contrast & Concession
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-지만: But …
- A/V-(으)ㄴ데도: Even though …
- A/V-아/어도: Even if …
- 아무리 A/V-아도/어도: No matter how …
- A/V-기는커녕: Far from …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 문제 (problem), 조건 (condition), 선택 (choice), 어려움 (difficulty), 희망 (hope)

Cultural Notes:
- Concessive forms show humility and acceptance, which are valued in Korean culture.

grammar.title: A-다고 들었다
grammar.translation: I heard from a friend that he’s going.

grammar.title: A-(으)냐고 하다
grammar.translation: The teacher asked where I was going.

grammar.title: V-자고 하다
grammar.translation: My friend suggested we go together.

grammar.title: A-(으)냐고 묻다
grammar.translation: He asked if I was a student.

grammar.title: A/V-다니(요)
grammar.description: 놀람 반박. What do you mean…!
grammar.translation: What do you mean he’s coming?

grammar.title: A/V-라니(요)
grammar.description: 반박 인용. How could you say…
grammar.translation: How could you say it’s a lie!

exams.question: Choose the correct reported command with V-(으)라고 하다.
Pick the correct suggestion with V-자고 하다.
Which sentence shows passive form with V-이/히/리/기?
Choose the correct causative form with V-게 하다.
Pick the correct formal quotation emphasis with A/V-다고(요).

summaries.title: Lesson 6: Purpose & Passive
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)려고 하다: Intend to …
- V-(으)ㄹ 예정이다: Be scheduled to …
- V-(으)려면: If intending to …
- V-이/히/리/기 (피동): Passive form
- V-이/히/리/기/우 (사동): Causative form

Essential Vocabulary:
- 계획 (plan), 약속 (promise), 수동 (passive), 사동 (causative), 노력 (effort)

Cultural Notes:
- Passive and causative expressions are critical for formal and academic Korean.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 생각이다
grammar.translation: I plan to study abroad this year.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 예정이다
grammar.translation: The meeting is scheduled for tomorrow.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ까 말까 하다
grammar.translation: I’m not sure whether to go or not.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 생각도 못 하다
grammar.translation: I never thought of doing that.

grammar.title: V-(으)려면
grammar.translation: If you want to pass, you must study hard.

exams.question: Choose the correct intention expression with V-(으)려고 하다.
Pick the correct planning expression with V-(으)ㄹ 생각이다.
Which sentence shows obligation with A/V-아야/어야 하다?
Choose the correct conditional expression with V-(으)려면.
Pick the correct hesitation expression with V-(으)ㄹ까 말까 하다.

summaries.title: Lesson 7: Temporal & Conditional
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄹ까 말까 하다: Hesitating whether to …
- V-아/어야겠다: I should …
- A/V-아야/어야 하다: Must …
- A/V-지 않으면 안 되다: Cannot not … (must)
- V-(으)ㄹ 생각이다 / 계획이다: Plan to …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 조건 (condition), 상황 (situation), 다짐 (resolution), 계획 (plan), 노력 (effort)

Cultural Notes:
- Obligation and planning forms show a speaker’s determination or hesitation.

grammar.title: 아무 N도
grammar.description: 부정 강조. No N at all.

grammar.title: 아무리 A/V-아도/어도
grammar.translation: No matter how hard I try, it doesn’t work.

grammar.title: 하도 A/V-아/어서
grammar.translation: I was so busy that I couldn’t go.

grammar.title: N(이)야말로
grammar.translation: This person is indeed the main character.

exams.question: Choose the correct emphatic negative sentence with 아무 N도.
Pick the correct inclusive expression with 누구나/언제나.
Which sentence correctly uses N(이)라도 for concession?
Choose the correct emphatic pattern with N(이)야말로.
Pick the correct expression of ending up doing with V-고 말다.

summaries.title: Lesson 8: Descriptive & Idiomatic Patterns
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 아무 N도: No N at all
- 누구나/언제나: Everyone / always
- 하도 A/V-아/어서: So … that …
- 여간 A/V-지 않다: Not easy …
- V-고 말다: End up doing …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 강조 (emphasis), 습관 (habit), 표현 (expression), 강조 (stress), 감정 (emotion)

Cultural Notes:
- Idiomatic patterns add emphasis and nuance beyond basic grammar.

grammar.title: V-이/히/리/기/우 (사동)
grammar.translation: I made him open the door.

grammar.title: V-(으)게끔 하다
grammar.translation: I made sure he saw it.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 줄 알았다
grammar.translation: I thought it would be easy.

exams.question: Choose the correct passive expression with V-이/히/리/기.
Pick the correct causative with V-게 하다.
Which sentence shows inevitability with V-(으)ㄹ 수밖에 없다?
Choose the correct worth-doing expression with V-(으)ㄹ 만하다.
Pick the correct alternative expression with V-(으)ㄹ 게 아니라.

summaries.title: Lesson 9: Stylistic Expressions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄹ 수밖에 없다: Cannot help but …
- V-(으)ㄹ 만하다: Worth doing …
- V-(으)ㄹ 줄 알았다: I thought …
- V-(으)ㄹ 줄 몰랐다: I didn’t expect …
- V-(으)ㄹ 게 아니라: Instead of …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 가치 (value), 기대 (expectation), 실망 (disappointment), 판단 (judgment), 선택 (choice)

Cultural Notes:
- Stylistic expressions make speech more elegant and sophisticated.

grammar.title: A/V-던데(요)
grammar.description: 경험 기반 말하기. I found that…

grammar.title: A/V-더니
grammar.translation: He studied and now he’s good.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)면서
grammar.translation: You learn a lot while living.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄴ 길에
grammar.translation: I bought it on the way.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ 길에
grammar.description: 가는 길에. On the way to…
grammar.translation: I met him on the way to school.

exams.question: Choose the correct descriptive contrast with A/V-(으)면서도.
Pick the correct simultaneous action with A/V-(으)면서.
Which sentence shows opportunity with V-(으)ㄴ 길에?
Choose the correct expression of fame with A/V-기로 유명하다.
Pick the correct supposition with A/V-(으)ㄴ 모양이다.

summaries.title: Lesson 10: Mixed Advanced Grammar
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-던데(요): I found that …
- A/V-았더니/었더니: After doing (result)
- A/V-(으)면서(도): While … (contrast)
- V-(으)ㄴ/을 길에: On the way …
- A/V-기로 유명하다: Be famous for …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 경험 (experience), 발견 (discovery), 대조 (contrast), 기회 (opportunity), 특징 (feature)

Cultural Notes:
- Mixing advanced forms builds fluency and natural flow in Korean.

exams.question: Select the correct adjective conjugation with A-아요/어요.
Which sentence correctly uses intensifiers with adjectives?
Choose the natural comparative using 보다.
options: 이 방은 저 방 조용보다 해요.

exams.question: Fill in the blank for the superlative: "이 음식이 _____ 맛있어요."
Error detection: Which sentence is awkward or incorrect?
Meaning check: In "A가 B보다 비싸요", what does 보다 indicate?

summaries.title: Lesson 47 — Adjectives & comparison
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- Predicate A-아요/어요; intensifiers 정말, 아주, 너무
- Comparative 보다; superlative 가장/제일
- Adnominal A-(으)ㄴ N to modify nouns
Essential Vocabulary:
- 조용하다, 맛있다, 크다, 작다, 재미있다
Cultural Notes:
- 너무 often means very in speech
- Pattern: A가 B보다 + adjective

grammar.title: A-다면서(요)?
grammar.description: 전달된 말을 확인. Confirming reported speech.
grammar.translation: I heard you are going tomorrow?

grammar.title: V-다 보면
grammar.description: 반복 중 결과. If one keeps doing, then…
grammar.example: 열심히 하다 보면 잘할 수 있어요.
grammar.translation: If you keep trying, you can do well.

grammar.title: N은/는 A-다는 것이다
grammar.description: 주장 강조. Emphasis on a statement.
grammar.translation: The point is that it is difficult.

grammar.title: V-는 대로
grammar.description: 따라. As soon as, according to.
grammar.translation: I said it as I thought of it.

grammar.title: 어찌나[얼마나] A-(으)ㄴ지
grammar.translation: It was so pretty that I admired it.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 정도로
grammar.translation: I studied to the point of exhaustion.

grammar.title: V-다가는
grammar.description: 부정적 결과. If one keeps doing, then…
grammar.translation: If you oversleep, you’ll be late.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 뿐만 아니라
grammar.description: 뿐 아니라. Not only … but also.
grammar.translation: He speaks not only Korean but also English.

grammar.title: V-(으)나 마나
grammar.description: 해도 소용없음. Whether or not, no use.

vocabulary.context: 열심히 하다 보면 잘할 수 있어요.

exams.question: Choose the correct reported statement with -다고 하다.
Pick the colloquial reported speech with -대요.
Which sentence reports a question using -(으)냐고 하다?
Choose the correct reported suggestion with -자고 하다.
Pick the correct sequential connector with -다가.

summaries.title: Lesson 1: Reported Speech & Sequential Forms
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A-다면서(요)?: Confirming report.
- V-다 보면: If keep doing …
- N은/는 A-다는 것이다: Emphasizing statement.
- V-는 대로: As soon as / according to …
- 어찌나 A-(으)ㄴ지: So … that …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 소문 (rumor), 반복 (repetition), 주장 (assertion), 순서 (order), 인용 (quotation)

Cultural Notes:
- Reported and sequential forms are common in narratives.

grammar.title: V-는 바람에
grammar.translation: I couldn’t go because it rained.

grammar.title: N에 비해(서)
grammar.translation: Compared to last year, it grew.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 수밖에 없다
grammar.translation: I have no choice but to do it.

grammar.title: A/V-고 해서
grammar.translation: I stayed home partly because I was tired.

grammar.title: A-다더니
grammar.description: 전달된 말 인용. You said that… but…
grammar.translation: You said it was cold, but now it’s hot.

exams.question: Choose the correct emphatic expression with -야말로.
Pick the correct comparative form with -보다.
Which sentence shows contrast with -(으)ㄴ데 반해?
options: 도시는 발달한 데 반해 농촌은 낙후되었다.

exams.question: Choose the correct intensifier.
Pick the correct superlative form.

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Emphasis & Comparative Forms
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-는 바람에: Because of (unexpected, negative)
- N(이)라는 N: Called/defined as …
- N에 비해(서): Compared to …
- A/V-기는커녕: Far from …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 게 뻔하다: It’s obvious that …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 비교 (comparison), 강조 (emphasis), 이유 (reason), 결과 (result), 예상 (expectation)

Cultural Notes:
- Comparative and emphatic forms are often used for nuanced communication.

grammar.title: V-다 보니(까)
grammar.description: 과정 중 깨달음. While doing… realized.
grammar.translation: While studying, I found it fun.

grammar.title: A/V-기는(요)
grammar.translation: Easy? Not at all, it’s hard.

grammar.title: A/V-든지 A/V-든지
grammar.translation: Go or not, do as you wish.

grammar.title: N(이)야말로
grammar.translation: This person indeed is the real one.

grammar.title: A/V-더라도
grammar.translation: Even if it’s hard, you must do it.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄴ 채(로)
grammar.translation: He came in with shoes on.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ지 A-(으)ㄴ지
grammar.translation: I don’t know whether it’s good or bad.

exams.question: Choose the correct concessive form with -아/어도.
Pick the correct contrastive form with -지만.
Which sentence uses -는데도 correctly?
Choose the correct emphatic concession with -더라도.
Pick the correct concessive structure.

summaries.title: Lesson 3: Concessive & Contrastive Structures
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-기 마련이다: Bound to …
- V-다 보니: While doing … realized …
- A/V-기는(요): Not really …
- A/V-든지 …든지: Whether … or …
- N(이)야말로: Indeed …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 대조 (contrast), 당연 (inevitability), 선택 (choice), 강조 (emphasis), 양보 (concession)

Cultural Notes:
- These expressions highlight inevitability, contrast, or emphasis.

grammar.title: V-아다(가)/어다(가)
grammar.description: 행위 이동. Do something and bring.

grammar.title: A-다는 N, V-ㄴ/는다는 N
grammar.translation: The rumor that he is going.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)며
grammar.description: 동시 동작. And / as well as.

grammar.title: A/V-았더라면/었더라면
grammar.description: 가정 과거. If it had been…
grammar.translation: If I had slept early, I wouldn’t be tired.

grammar.title: V-기(가) 무섭게
grammar.translation: As soon as he arrived, he left.

exams.question: Choose the correct cause expression with -기 때문에.
Pick the correct reason expression with -아/어서.
Which sentence shows inevitability with -(으)ㄹ 수밖에 없다?
Choose the correct result expression with -고 보니.
Pick the correct causal clause with -(으)므로.

summaries.title: Lesson 4: Cause & Effect Expressions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-아다/어다(가): Do something and bring …
- A-다는 N, V-ㄴ/는다는 N: Quoted noun clause …
- N을/를 비롯해서: Including …
- A/V-(으)며: And / as well as …
- A/V-거든: If … (casual)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 원인 (cause), 결과 (effect), 인용 (quotation), 조건 (condition), 예시 (example)

Cultural Notes:
- Cause-and-effect grammar is important in academic and formal texts.

grammar.title: N치고
grammar.example: 학생치고 공부 안 하는 사람 없다.
grammar.translation: There’s no student who doesn’t study.

grammar.title: A-다는 것은 N에서 알 수 있다
grammar.description: 근거 판단. We can see that…
grammar.example: 성실하다는 것은 결과에서 알 수 있다.
grammar.translation: We can see diligence from the results.

grammar.title: N에 의하면
grammar.translation: According to the news, it’s true.

grammar.title: V-(으)려다(가)
grammar.description: 하려다 중단. Tried to… but stopped.
grammar.translation: I tried to go but couldn’t.

vocabulary.context: 학생치고 공부 안 하는 사람 없다.

exams.question: Choose the correct quotative clause with -다는.
Pick the correct descriptive clause with -(으)ㄴ.
Which sentence uses -는 clause correctly?
Choose the correct future descriptive with -(으)ㄹ.
Pick the correct nominal clause.

summaries.title: Lesson 5: Quotative & Descriptive Clauses
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N 만에: After (time period)
- A/V-(으)나: Although …
- N치고: For a … without exception
- A-다는 것은 N에서 알 수 있다: We can see that …
- N에 의하면: According to …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 소문 (rumor), 근거 (basis), 기간 (time period), 예외 (exception), 설명 (explanation)

Cultural Notes:
- Quotative and descriptive noun clauses strengthen arguments.

grammar.title: V-는 김에
grammar.translation: Throw out the trash while going out.

grammar.title: N과/와 달리
grammar.translation: Unlike his brother, he is quiet.

grammar.title: N에 따라(서)
grammar.translation: It differs depending on the person.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ 셈이다
grammar.translation: It’s as if today is a success.

grammar.title: N에 불과하다
grammar.description: 그 이상 아님. No more than…
grammar.translation: This is nothing but an excuse.

grammar.title: N만 못하다
grammar.description: 못 미침. Not as good as…

grammar.title: N(으)로서
grammar.translation: As a teacher, you have responsibility.

exams.question: Choose the correct hypothetical clause with -(으)면.
Pick the correct concessive clause with -(으)ㄹ지라도.
Which sentence uses -더라도 correctly?
Choose the correct concession with -아/어도.
Pick the correct supposition with -(으)ㄹ 텐데.

summaries.title: Lesson 6: Concessions & Hypotheticals
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-는 김에: While at it …
- V-느니 차라리: Would rather …
- N과/와 달리: Unlike …
- N에 따라(서): Depending on …
- A-(으)ㄴ 데다가: Moreover …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 가정 (assumption), 조건 (condition), 비교 (comparison), 예시 (example), 덧붙임 (addition)

Cultural Notes:
- Hypothetical and concessive structures are common in advanced discourse.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)므로
grammar.translation: Because he worked hard, he succeeded.

grammar.title: N에 의해(서)
grammar.translation: The result changes due to effort.

grammar.title: V-곤 하다
grammar.translation: I used to take a walk every weekend.

grammar.title: V-는 사이(에)
grammar.translation: He came while I was sleeping.

exams.question: Choose the correct immediate action with -자마자.
Pick the correct sequential connector with -고 나서.
Which sentence uses -다가 correctly?
Choose the correct habitual temporal with -(으)면.
Pick the correct delayed realization with -고 보니.

summaries.title: Lesson 7: Temporal & Sequential Patterns
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-(으)므로: Because … (formal)
- A-다기보다는: Rather than …
- 설마 A/V-겠어요?: Surely not …
- N(으)로부터: From …
- N에 의해(서): Due to …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 시간 (time), 원인 (cause), 결과 (result), 근거 (basis), 순서 (sequence)

Cultural Notes:
- Temporal and sequential patterns are vital in narratives.

grammar.title: N뿐만 아니라
grammar.description: 뿐 아니라. Not only… but also…
grammar.translation: Not only books but also newspapers.

grammar.title: V-고도
grammar.translation: He didn’t come even though he promised.

exams.question: Choose the correct comparative expression.
Pick the correct limitation with -(으)ㄹ 뿐이다.
Which sentence uses restriction with -에 그치다?
Choose the correct example with -의 대표적인 예로.
options: 김치를 대표적인 예로 들 수 있다.
김치를 대표적인 예로 들 수 있다만.
김치를 대표적인 예로 들 수 있다요.

exams.question: Pick the correct superlative limitation with -뿐만 아니라.

summaries.title: Lesson 8: Comparative & Limitation
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N(이)며 N(이)며: And … and …
- A/V-건만: Although …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 따름이다: Merely …
- N뿐만 아니라: Not only … but also …
- A/V-아/어도: Even if …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 제한 (limitation), 비교 (comparison), 첨가 (addition), 양보 (concession), 조건 (condition)

Cultural Notes:
- Comparative and limiting expressions are used to refine nuance.

grammar.title: N에 지나지 않다
grammar.description: 그 이상 아님. Nothing more than…

grammar.title: A/V-(으)리라
grammar.translation: I believe he will keep it.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)므로
grammar.translation: He succeeded because he worked hard.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄴ 바 있다
grammar.description: 사실 언급. There is a case that…

exams.question: Choose the correct stylistic expression with -(으)리라.
Pick the correct formal expression with -(으)ㅁ.
Which sentence uses formal -(으)오 correctly?
Choose the correct stylistic emphasis.
Pick the correct literary concessive with -더라도.

summaries.title: Lesson 9: Stylistic & Formal Constructions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N에 지나지 않다: Nothing more than …
- N만 해도: For example …
- A/V-듯하다: It seems …
- A/V-(으)리라: Surely/intend to …
- N에 따라: Depending on …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 문체 (style), 형식 (formality), 예시 (example), 원인 (cause), 추측 (supposition)

Cultural Notes:
- Formal and stylistic constructions appear in literature and formal speech.

grammar.title: V-는 한
grammar.translation: As long as I have money, I’ll help.

grammar.title: V-아/어 봤자
grammar.translation: Even if you say it, it’s useless.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ세라
grammar.translation: I hurried for fear of being late.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄴ/는 이상
grammar.translation: Since you promised, you must keep it.

exams.question: Choose the correct repetition pattern with -다시피.
Pick the correct stylistic conjunction with -거나 하다.
Which sentence shows futility with -아/어 봤자?
Choose the correct stylistic ending with -고 말았다.
Pick the correct mixed concessive form.

summaries.title: Lesson 10: Mixed Advanced Patterns
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-는 김에: While at it …
- V-는 한: As long as …
- V-(으)ㄴ 끝에: After … finally …
- 어디 N뿐인가: Not only …
- V-아/어 봤자: Even if … no use …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 종합 (integration), 조건 (condition), 강조 (emphasis), 결과 (result), 헛됨 (futility)

Cultural Notes:
- Mixed advanced patterns combine concessions, repetition, and stylistic devices.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 N에 N
grammar.description: 복잡 수식 Relative clause with nouns.
grammar.translation: The story about the movie I watched yesterday.

grammar.title: N(까지)는 못 돼도 N은/는 A/V-(으)ㄹ 줄 알았다
grammar.example: 합격까지는 못 돼도 인터뷰는 할 줄 알았다.
grammar.translation: I thought I could at least get an interview even if not pass.

grammar.title: V-는 둥 마는 둥
grammar.example: 밥을 먹는 둥 마는 둥 했다.

grammar.title: A/V-다는 인상을 주다
grammar.translation: Give the impression of being serious.

grammar.title: V-는 한이 있어도
grammar.translation: Even if it means staying up all night, I’ll finish it.

grammar.title: V-는 등 (재능을 발휘하다)
grammar.translation: He showed talent by singing, etc.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄴ 바 있다
grammar.description: 경험 언급 There has been a case…
grammar.translation: There was a case of success.

grammar.title: V-다시피
grammar.description: 정도 강조 As you know / Almost as…
grammar.translation: As I told you, results are important.

grammar.title: N(이)나마
grammar.translation: I want to help, even if just a little.

grammar.title: V-고자
grammar.translation: I came to Korea in order to learn more.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 지경이다
grammar.description: 극단 상황 To the point of…
grammar.translation: I’m so tired I’m about to collapse.

grammar.title: 생각다 못해
grammar.translation: As a last resort, I asked a friend.

exams.question: Choose the correct relative clause expression.
Pick the correct concession with V-는 한이 있어도.
Which sentence shows intention with V-고자?
Choose the correct extreme expression with A/V-(으)ㄹ 지경이다.
Pick the correct last-resort expression.

summaries.title: Lesson 1: Advanced Expressions I
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 N에 N: Relative clause with nouns
- V-는 둥 마는 둥: Half-heartedly
- A/V-다는 소리를 듣다: Hear that …
- V-는 한이 있어도: Even if it means …
- V-고자: In order to (formal)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 인상 (impression), 소문 (rumor), 과정 (process), 선택 (choice), 극단 (extreme)

Cultural Notes:
- Formal purpose expressions and nuanced advanced clauses are common in academic/professional Korean.

grammar.title: N(이)란 N은/는 모두
grammar.translation: I spent every bit of money.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄹ/V-는데(에) 비해
grammar.translation: The quantity is large, but the quality is poor.

grammar.title: N의 특징은 A/V-다는데 있다
grammar.description: 특징 강조 The feature lies in…
grammar.translation: The feature of Korean lies in honorifics.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ가/V-는가 하면
grammar.description: 대조 On one hand… on the other hand…
grammar.example: 어떤 사람은 찬성하는가 하면 반대하는 사람도 있다.
grammar.translation: Some people agree, while others oppose.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는데(에) 반해
grammar.example: 도시는 발달한 데 반해 농촌은 낙후되었다.
grammar.translation: The city developed, whereas the countryside lagged behind.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㅁ에 따라
grammar.translation: As the economy developed, life improved.

grammar.title: 단
grammar.example: 참석은 가능하다. 단, 미리 신청해야 한다.
grammar.translation: Attendance is possible, provided that you register in advance.

grammar.title: N은/는 N에 그치다
grammar.translation: Sales were limited to 1 billion won.

grammar.title: N의 대표적인 예로 N을/를 들다
grammar.description: 예시 Take… as a representative example.
grammar.example: 한국 음식의 대표적인 예로 김치를 들 수 있다.
grammar.translation: Kimchi can be taken as a representative example of Korean food.

grammar.title: N 외
grammar.description: 포함 제외 Apart from… except for…
grammar.translation: He is good at science apart from math.

grammar.title: A/V-다면
grammar.translation: If I had time, I would like to travel.

grammar.title: 아래와 같이
grammar.translation: The meeting will proceed as follows.

grammar.title: V-(으)오니
grammar.translation: Since we ask for your presence, we request your cooperation.

vocabulary.context: 도시는 발달한 데 반해 농촌은 낙후되었다.

exams.question: Choose the correct emphasizing expression with N(이)란 N은/는 모두.
Pick the correct contrast with A-(으)ㄴ/V-는데(에) 비해.
Which sentence correctly shows limitation with N은/는 N에 그치다?
Choose the correct formal conditional with A/V-다면.
Pick the correct formal request expression with V-(으)오니.

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Advanced Expressions II
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N(이)란 N은/는 모두: Every … without exception
- A-(으)ㄴ가/V-는가 하면: On one hand … on the other hand …
- V-(으)ㅁ에 따라: As/according to …
- A-(으)ㄴ/V-는데(에) 반해: Whereas …
- V-(으)오니: Since … (formal request)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 특징 (characteristic), 통계 (statistics), 조건 (condition), 응답 (response), 비교 (comparison)

Cultural Notes:
- Korean advanced expressions often mix statistics, comparisons, and formal styles in reports.

grammar.title: N에 한하여
grammar.translation: This discount is limited to students.

grammar.title: N이/가 중요한 역할을 하다
grammar.example: 선생님이 학생의 성장에 중요한 역할을 한다.
grammar.translation: Teachers play an important role in students’ growth.

grammar.title: N에서 N의 비중이 높다
grammar.description: 비율 Have a large proportion in…
grammar.translation: The service industry has a high proportion of employment.

grammar.title: N(으)로 인해
grammar.translation: Damage occurred due to heavy rain.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 탓
grammar.translation: I fell because I ran too fast.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)면 그만이다
grammar.description: 조건 As long as… that’s enough.
grammar.translation: It’s enough as long as you tried hard.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ뿐더러
grammar.translation: He not only speaks English well but also Korean.

grammar.title: 이래 가지고(서)(야)
grammar.translation: Do you think you can succeed like this?

grammar.title: V-(으)ㅁ으로써
grammar.translation: You improve your skills by practicing.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 면이 있다
grammar.description: 특징 There is an aspect of…
grammar.example: 그의 말에도 일리가 있는 면이 있다.
grammar.translation: There is some truth in what he says.

grammar.title: N은/는 N을/를 보여 주는
grammar.example: 이 성과는 노력을 보여 주는 결과다.
grammar.translation: This achievement shows the result of effort.

grammar.title: A/V-기에
grammar.translation: I brought an umbrella because it was raining.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㅁ에 틀림없다
grammar.description: 확신 There is no doubt that…
grammar.translation: There is no doubt he is Korean.

vocabulary.context: 선생님이 학생의 성장에 중요한 역할을 한다.

exams.question: Choose the correct restriction expression with N에 한하여.
Pick the correct responsibility expression with A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 탓.
Which sentence adds with A/V-(으)ㄹ뿐더러?
Choose the correct method expression with V-(으)ㅁ으로써.
Pick the correct certainty with A/V-(으)ㅁ에 틀림없다.

summaries.title: Lesson 3: Advanced Expressions III
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N에 한하여: Limited to …
- A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 탓: Because of (negative cause)
- A/V-(으)면 그만이다: As long as … that’s enough
- A/V-(으)ㄹ뿐더러: Not only … but also …
- V-(으)ㅁ으로써: By/through …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 역할 (role), 비중 (proportion), 원인 (cause), 수단 (means), 특징 (feature)

Cultural Notes:
- Expressions in this lesson are essential for formal writing, contracts, and academic contexts.

grammar.title: 한마디로 말하자면
grammar.description: 설명 In short… to sum up…
grammar.translation: In short, he is a genius.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 점이 특징적이다
grammar.example: 이 건물은 디자인이 독특한 점이 특징적이다.
grammar.translation: This building is characterized by its unique design.

grammar.title: N을/를 N(으)로 꼽다
grammar.example: 서울을 가장 살고 싶은 도시로 꼽는다.
grammar.translation: They pick Seoul as the most livable city.

grammar.title: 뭐니 뭐니 해도
grammar.translation: After all, health is the most important.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)리만큼
grammar.translation: He is sincere enough to be trusted.

grammar.title: N을/를 계기로
grammar.translation: He studied hard after entering school.

grammar.title: A/V-지(요), 뭐
grammar.description: 담담 Well, you know… that’s how it is.
grammar.example: 사람 사는 게 다 그렇지요, 뭐.

grammar.title: A/V-겠거니
grammar.translation: I assumed he would be late.

grammar.title: 다시 말해서
grammar.translation: In other words, it means failure.

grammar.title: V-(으)려는지
grammar.translation: I don’t know what he is trying to say.

grammar.title: V-기 십상이다
grammar.translation: Doing it that way is most likely to fail.

grammar.title: A/V-거나 하다
grammar.translation: I read books or listen to music, or something like that.

vocabulary.context: 서울을 가장 살고 싶은 도시로 꼽는다.

exams.question: Choose the correct summarizing expression.
Pick the correct expression with N을/를 계기로.
Which sentence is a natural colloquial delivery with 그러더라고요?
Choose the correct exaggeration with A/V-다고 해도 과언이 아니다.
Pick the correct bound-to expression with V-기 십상이다.

summaries.title: Lesson 4: Advanced Expressions IV
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 한마디로 말하자면: In short …
- 뭐니 뭐니 해도: After all …
- A/V-(으)리만큼: As much as …
- N을/를 계기로: Take … as an opportunity
- V-기 십상이다: Bound to … most likely …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 계기 (opportunity), 설명 (explanation), 강조 (emphasis), 분석 (analysis), 추측 (assumption)

Cultural Notes:
- These forms provide advanced stylistic flavor in essays, debates, and formal speech.

grammar.title: N을/를 막론하고
grammar.example: 나이와 성별을 막론하고 지원할 수 있다.
grammar.translation: You can apply regardless of age or gender.

grammar.title: N은/는 물론이거니와
grammar.translation: Not only English but also Korean is good.

grammar.title: N을/를 말하라면
grammar.translation: Speaking of hobbies, mine is reading.

grammar.title: N이자 N
grammar.translation: He is both a teacher and a writer.

grammar.title: 한편으로(는)
grammar.translation: On the one hand I was happy, on the other I was sad.

grammar.title: V-아/어 내다
grammar.translation: I managed to solve the problem.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 만큼
grammar.translation: There is achievement as much as the effort.

grammar.title: A/V-다고 해도 과언이 아니다
grammar.description: 강조 It’s no exaggeration to say…
grammar.translation: It’s no exaggeration to say he is a genius.

grammar.title: (V-(으)ㄹ 겸) V-(으)ㄹ 겸
grammar.description: 겸사 Do A as well as B.
grammar.translation: I went to the mart to shop as well as to take a walk.

grammar.title: A-기 짝이 없다
grammar.translation: His attitude is nothing but rude.

grammar.title: N(이)니 N(이)니 하다
grammar.translation: I brought things like books and notebooks.

grammar.title: N 여부
grammar.translation: Please let me know whether or not you’ll attend.

grammar.title: V-다시피 하다
grammar.translation: I studied almost all day long.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄴ 나머지
grammar.translation: He cried as a result of being happy.

vocabulary.context: 나이와 성별을 막론하고 지원할 수 있다.

summaries.title: Lesson 5: Advanced Expressions V
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N을/를 막론하고: Regardless of …
- N은/는 물론이거니와: Not only … but also …
- (V-(으)ㄹ 겸) V-(으)ㄹ 겸: Do A as well as B
- A/V-다고 해도 과언이 아니다: It’s no exaggeration to say …
- A-기 짝이 없다: Extremely … nothing more …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 강조 (emphasis), 완수 (completion), 판단 (judgment), 나열 (listing), 결과 (result)

Cultural Notes:
- These are highly advanced stylistic and emphatic patterns, common in literature and formal rhetoric.

grammar.title: A/V-건 (간에)
grammar.description: 상관없음을 나타냄. Whether A or V, it does not matter.
grammar.example: 비가 오건 눈이 오건 갈 거예요.
grammar.translation: Whether it rains or snows, I will go.

grammar.title: V-기 일쑤(이)다
grammar.description: 자주 반복되는 부정적 상황. It is common (usually negative).
grammar.example: 그는 숙제를 안 해 오기 일쑤예요.
grammar.translation: He often doesn’t do his homework.

grammar.title: A/V-거니와
grammar.description: 앞 절과 뒤 절 모두 사실임. Not only … but also.
grammar.translation: He is not only smart but also diligent.

grammar.title: A/V-다손 치더라도
grammar.description: 설사 그렇다고 해도. Even if … is true.
grammar.example: 그 말이 사실이다손 치더라도 믿기 어려워요.
grammar.translation: Even if that is true, it’s hard to believe.

grammar.title: N은/는 말할 것도 없다
grammar.description: 당연히 포함됨. Not to mention N.
grammar.example: 한국어는 말할 것도 없고 영어도 잘해요.
grammar.translation: Not to mention Korean, he also speaks English.

grammar.title: V-(으)려고 들다
grammar.description: 의도를 강하게 가지려 함. To try hard/intend to do.
grammar.translation: Even if I try to go early, traffic is heavy.

vocabulary.context: 비가 오건 눈이 오건 갈 거예요.
비가 오건 눈이 오건 갈 거예요.
그 말이 사실이다손 치더라도 믿기 어려워요.
한국어는 말할 것도 없고 영어도 잘해요.

Pick the correct neutral expression with -기는 하지만.

Pick the correct neutral concessive expression.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 양
grammar.translation: He didn’t answer as if he didn’t know.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)리라
grammar.translation: I vowed I would never be late again.

grammar.title: N에도 불구하고
grammar.translation: Despite the rain, the game was held.

grammar.title: V-자
grammar.translation: As soon as he came home, he took a shower.

grammar.title: N(으)로 보다
grammar.description: 근거로 삼음. To judge by N.
grammar.example: 그의 말로 보아 사실인 것 같아요.
grammar.translation: Judging by his words, it seems true.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 가운데
grammar.description: 진행되는 상황 속에서. In the midst of …
grammar.translation: A guest came in the middle of the meeting.

vocabulary.context: 그의 말로 보아 사실인 것 같아요.

exams.question: Choose the correct hypothetical expression with -(으)면.
Pick the correct descriptive clause with -(으)ㄴ/는.

Pick the correct supposition expression.

summaries.title: Lesson 2: Descriptive & Hypothetical Forms
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 양: As if …
- A/V-(으)리라: Surely/intend to.
- N에도 불구하고: Despite N.
- V-자: As soon as …
- N(으)로 보다: To judge by …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 상황 (situation), 조건 (condition), 결과 (result), 가능성 (possibility), 가정 (assumption)

Cultural Notes:
- Hypothetical forms are essential for advanced sentence building.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ래야 V-(으)ㄹ 수 없다
grammar.description: 하려 해도 불가능. Even if one tries, can’t.
grammar.translation: Even if I try to forget, I can’t.

grammar.title: 어찌나 A/V-던지
grammar.translation: I was so tired that I slept immediately.

grammar.title: A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 까닭에
grammar.translation: Because it rained, I couldn’t go.

grammar.title: A/V-다 뿐이지
grammar.description: 다른 점은 없음. It’s only that …
grammar.translation: It’s only a little late, no problem.

exams.question: Choose the correct expression of inability with -(으)ㄹ 수 없다.
Pick the correct futility expression with -아/어 봤자.
Which sentence uses 하도 A/V-아/어서 correctly?
Choose the correct idiomatic expression with -기는커녕.
Pick the correct extreme emphasis with A-기 짝이 없다.

summaries.title: Lesson 3: Inability & Intensity
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄹ래야 V-(으)ㄹ 수 없다: Even if try, can’t.
- 어찌나 A/V-던지: So … that …
- V-(으)ㄹ 바에는: Rather than …
- A-(으)ㄴ/V-는 까닭에: Because …
- A/V-다 뿐이지: It’s only that …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 도저히 (by no means), 절대로 (absolutely not), 이유 (reason), 정도 (extent), 차라리 (rather)

Cultural Notes:
- These patterns emphasize futility or strong intensity.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ지라도
grammar.translation: Even though it’s hard, I will finish.

grammar.title: V-는 한
grammar.translation: As long as I have money, I’ll help.

grammar.title: V-고서는
grammar.example: 밥을 먹고서는 바로 뛰면 안 돼요.
grammar.translation: Once you eat, you shouldn’t run immediately.

grammar.title: V-게끔
grammar.translation: Write big so it can be seen well.

grammar.title: A-(으)면서(도)
grammar.translation: He smiled even while saying sorry.

vocabulary.context: 밥을 먹고서는 바로 뛰면 안 돼요.

exams.question: Choose the correct concessive expression with -(으)ㄹ망정.
Pick the correct use of -(으)ㄹ지라도.

Pick the correct concessive expression.

summaries.title: Lesson 4: Concessive & Conditional II
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- A/V-(으)ㄹ지라도: Even though …
- V-는 한: As long as …
- V-고서는: Once … then can’t …
- V-게끔: So that …
- A-(으)면서도: Even while …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 조건 (condition), 상황 (situation), 한계 (limit), 노력 (effort), 양보 (concession)

Cultural Notes:
- Used to express concessions and hypothetical restrictions.

grammar.title: N더러
grammar.translation: I asked him to tell the teacher.

grammar.title: N이/가 다 뭐예요?
grammar.translation: What’s money for? Health is important.

grammar.title: N은/는 고사하고
grammar.translation: I couldn’t even drink water, let alone eat.

grammar.title: A/V-다든지 하다
grammar.translation: On weekends, I either read or exercise.

exams.question: Choose the correct emphatic repetition with -다니까요.
Pick the correct use of -다니(요) for surprise.
Which sentence uses -더라(고요) correctly?
Choose the correct emphatic expression.
Pick the correct idiomatic emphasis.

summaries.title: Lesson 5: Interaction & Emphasis
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N더러: Toward N.
- N이/가 다 뭐예요?: What’s the point of …?
- N은/는 고사하고: Let alone …
- (비록) A/V-(으)ㄹ망정: Even though … still …
- N만 해도: For example, even …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 예시 (example), 강조 (emphasis), 대화 (conversation), 불만 (complaint), 대상 (target)

Cultural Notes:
- Interactional forms often appear in conversational Korean.

grammar.title: 설사 A/V-다(고) 해도
grammar.translation: Even if it rains, I’ll go.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ라치면
grammar.translation: Whenever I try to go out, a call comes.

grammar.title: A/V-던 차에
grammar.description: 그때 마침. Just at the moment …
grammar.translation: I stopped by on my way home.

exams.question: Choose the correct comparative expression with -(으)ㄴ/V-는데 비해.
Pick the correct expression of supposition with -(으)ㄹ걸.
Which sentence shows assumption with -(으)ㄴ가 보다?
Choose the correct conjecture with -(으)ㄹ 모양이다.
Pick the correct probabilistic expression with -(으)ㄹ 듯하다.

summaries.title: Lesson 6: Comparisons & Suppositions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N와/과 맞먹다: Comparable to …
- 설사 A/V-다(고) 해도: Even if …
- V-(으)ㄹ라치면: Whenever trying to …
- A/V-다고 치다: Let’s suppose …
- V-(으)ㄹ 리(가) 만무하다: Impossible …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 비교 (comparison), 추측 (supposition), 가능성 (possibility), 동등 (equivalence), 가정 (assumption)

Cultural Notes:
- Advanced comparison forms strengthen argumentation.

grammar.title: V-고도
grammar.translation: Even after sleeping late, I woke up early.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 성싶다
grammar.translation: It seems it will snow today.

grammar.title: V-ㄴ/는답시고
grammar.translation: I claimed to exercise but overate.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)ㄹ 턱이 없다
grammar.translation: There’s no way that could happen.

grammar.title: N(으)로 말미암아
grammar.translation: Because of the flood, damage was severe.

exams.question: Choose the correct expression of immediate sequence with -자마자.
Pick the correct cause expression with -느라고.

Pick the correct pattern with -(으)ㄹ 뻔하다.

summaries.title: Lesson 7: Aftermath & Probability
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-고도: Even after doing …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 성싶다: It seems …
- (비록) A/V-(으)ㄹ지언정: Even though …
- V-ㄴ/는답시고: Claiming to …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 턱이 없다: No chance …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 결과 (result), 추측 (probability), 사건 (incident), 핑계 (excuse), 원인 (cause)

Cultural Notes:
- These structures express aftermath, excuses, and likelihood.

grammar.title: N에 지나지 않다
grammar.description: 그 이상 아님. Nothing more than …
grammar.translation: That’s nothing more than an excuse.

grammar.title: A/V-기로서니
grammar.translation: Even if you have money, you can’t buy health.

grammar.title: N인지라
grammar.translation: Since I am a student, I have no money.

grammar.title: V-자니
grammar.translation: I want to buy it, but no money; throw it away, but wasteful.

exams.question: Choose the correct limiting expression with -(으)ㄹ 따름이다.
Pick the correct formal request with -(으)오니.
Which sentence shows restriction with -(으)ㄹ 뿐이다?
Choose the correct formal conditional with -노라면.
Pick the correct limitation expression with -(으)ㄹ 수밖에 없다.

summaries.title: Lesson 8: Limitation & Formal Requests
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- N에 지나지 않다: Nothing more than …
- A/V-기로서니: Even if …
- V-아/어 주십사: Humbly request …
- N인지라: Since …
- V-자니: When trying to … (problem)

Essential Vocabulary:
- 제한 (limitation), 부탁 (request), 이유 (reason), 자격 (qualification), 조건 (condition)

Cultural Notes:
- Often used in formal and professional contexts.

grammar.title: 어디 N뿐인가
grammar.translation: Is it only students? Teachers are also there.

grammar.title: V-아/어 봤자
grammar.description: 해도 소용없음. Even if …, no use.
grammar.translation: Even if you say it, it’s useless.

grammar.title: V-(으)랴 V-(으)랴
grammar.description: 둘 다 해야 함. Have to do both …

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄹ세라
grammar.translation: I hurried for fear of being late.

grammar.title: N을/를 불문하고
grammar.translation: Regardless of gender, you can apply.

exams.question: Choose the correct futility expression with -아/어 봤자.
Pick the correct emphatic expression with -고야 말다.
Which sentence correctly shows futile effort with -(으)나 마나.
Choose the correct emphatic repetition with -고 말았다.
Pick the correct futile action expression.

summaries.title: Lesson 9: Emphatic & Futile Actions
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- 어디 N뿐인가: Not only …
- V-느니만 못하다: Would rather …
- V-아/어 봤자: Even if … no use.
- V-(으)랴 V-(으)랴: Have to do both …
- V-(으)ㄹ세라: For fear that …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 헛되다 (futile), 두려움 (fear), 강조 (emphasis), 선택 (choice), 노력 (effort)

Cultural Notes:
- These patterns convey futility and emphasis.

grammar.title: V-(으)ㄴ/는 이상
grammar.translation: Since we started, we must finish.

grammar.title: A/V-(으)니/느니 …
grammar.translation: Whether it rains or snows, the weather is bad.

grammar.title: A/V-건만
grammar.translation: It’s good, but expression is clumsy.

grammar.title: V-는 게 고작이다
grammar.translation: All he does is help a little.

vocabulary.context: 도시는 발달한 데 반해 농촌은 낙후되었다.
도시는 발달한 데 반해 농촌은 낙후되었다.

exams.question: Choose the correct conclusive expression with -(으)ㄹ 따름이다.
Pick the correct stylistic pattern with -(으)ㅁ.
Which sentence correctly uses -(으)리라.
Choose the correct stylistic expression with -(으)오.
Pick the correct literary expression with -(으)리만큼.

summaries.title: Lesson 10: Conclusive & Stylistic Patterns
summaries.content:
Key Grammar Points:
- V-(으)ㄴ/는 이상: Since …
- A/V-(으)니/느니: Whether … or …
- A/V-건만: Although …
- V-는 게 고작이다: Only just …
- A/V-(으)ㄹ 따름이다: Merely …

Essential Vocabulary:
- 결론 (conclusion), 대조 (contrast), 한계 (limit), 단순 (simplicity), 원칙 (principle)

Cultural Notes:
- Stylistic expressions appear often in advanced writing.
